definition: to waste time on worthless activities
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to estimate/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
surname Yin

sentences.english: Each moment is a gift so do not waste this gift by feeling sorry for yourself or anxious.
sentences.chinese: 每一刻都是生命的賜予，不要因焦慮而虛度光陰。

sentences.english: Hell, in the past few years you’ve been all but killed about a million times.
sentences.chinese: 該死，在過去的幾年裏你除了虛度光陰以外一事無成。

sentences.english: Xiao Qiu was filled with remorse over the wasted time.
sentences.chinese: 小邱因虛度光陰而懊悔。

sentences.english: The teacher told the students not to  loiter their time away.
sentences.chinese: 老師告訴學生不要虛度光陰。

sentences.english: Don't loiter ; keep moving ; it may rain to-morrow.
sentences.chinese: 別虛度光陰，勇往直前，就算明天會下雨。

sentences.english: I wish I had made better use of my time when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 當我年輕的時候，沒有虛度光陰的話該多好。

sentences.english: Man have wasted away in front of it.
sentences.chinese: 人會在鏡子前虛度光陰。

sentences.english: No wasted time, I would like to dream of my heart for the fight.
sentences.chinese: 不再虛度光陰，我要爲我心中的夢想而奮鬥。

sentences.english: When I think of all the time I've wasted, I could cry.
sentences.chinese: 當我想起我一直在虛度光陰，我只能哭。

sentences.english: The teacher told the students not to loiter their time away.
sentences.chinese: 老師告訴學生不要虛度光陰。

to force someone to do something
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
